intro: Condylostylis latidenticulata, commonly known as the narrow-toothed condylostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with finely serrated margins. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
